title: Senior Systems Engineer
content:
Company Overview:
Second Order Effects (SOE) is an engineering consultancy that transforms uncertainty into fully functional hardware and software. We work on projects at various stages of development and scope; we perform analysis, build prototypes, and take products to market. Our cross-disciplinary team solves critical problems across numerous industries, including automotive, aerospace, consumer electronics, industrial automation, biomedical, green energy, and marine. Our designs control rocket engines, manage satellite communications, generate safety-overrides for self-driving cars, and are enjoyed by consumers around the world. 
Founded in 2016, Second Order Effects has 90+ employees (and counting!) in offices in El Segundo, California and Redmond, Washington. We've worked with 90+ clients on 250+ projects as a partner, on a retainer, or on demand, all of which have no involvement with weapons.
How do we do this? We prioritize others, build the right thing, welcome difficulty, and play the long game. Learn more at soeffects.com!
Team Overview:
The Programs team is responsible for ensuring project success across the range of projects that SOE encounters. We work to improve project outcomes, maximize learning opportunities, identify new ways to support our clients, and drive efficiency of project execution. At the frontlines of every client engagement, we collect data on the efficacy of the SOE services engine to inform the development of seamless processes and to inform how groups like Engineering, Business Development, and Operations should spend their time across project execution, personal growth, and infrastructure development.
Job Overview:
As a Systems Engineer, Senior, you will work with other engineers and project managers to design efficient technical processes and implement them across multiple engineering projects. On a day to day basis, you will keep track of deliverables, risk, and scope for projects and be responsible for ensuring project delivery by bridging communication between engineering, customers, and other departments.
What You Will Do:

Manage requirements and system architecture design
Drive action items with engineering and customer teams while maintaining and developing systems for requirements tracking and communication
Facilitate and drive the creation of project budgets, work breakdowns, rough order estimates, task prioritization, and integration plans
Work with project teams to develop processes and best practices to help deliver quality products
Track work across multiple projects
Research and recommend project management policies and practices
Prepare reports and other associated systems for project and/or program documentation

What You Will Need:

Bachelor's Degree (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, related field)
5+ years of applied experience with engineering projects and system design
Ability to recognize project risk, scope creep, and missing critical requirements
Familiarity with the execution and labor breakdown of engineering projects; well-versed in the required skills to execute engineering projects involving end-to-end electrical system design
Familiarity with project engineering tools like Smartsheet, Confluence, Jira, or Mavenlink; ability to implement low-overhead systems track work and effort
High level of organization and excellent technical communications skills

What Would Be Useful:

Master’s degree (Electrical Engineering, Computer Science, Physics, Math, related field)
Working experience in highly technical electrical engineering project management capacity, spanning a range of products and industries (e.g., aerospace, automotive, industrial, consumer electronics, etc.)
Experience with electrical engineering design work and strong knowledge of embedded systems, firmware, power electronics, analog control and discrete logic design, as well as related mechanical systems and packaging for aerospace, automotive, and/or consumer electronics products
Experience with aerospace and EMI/EMC standards and knowledge of radiation effects
Experience with automated test systems or qualification testing for aerospace or automotive
Familiarity with Python and/or MATLAB for data parsing and signal analysis
Familiarity with quality control systems, such as AS9100 or ISO
Comfort with Linux systems and desktop environments

Additional Requirements:

Applicant must be willing to work 40 hours a week on-site in El Segundo, California, USA
Applicant must be eligible to work on ITAR projects
Job Type: Full-time (Salary)

ITAR Requirements:

To conform to U.S. Government space technology export regulations, including the International Traffic in Arms Regulations (ITAR), you must be a U.S. citizen, lawful permanent resident of the U.S., protected individual as defined by 8 U.S.C. 1324b(a)(3), or eligible to obtain the required authorizations from the U.S. Department of State. Unfortunately, we are unable to provide sponsorship at this time.

Benefits:

Compensation range of $140,000-$180,000 + equity incentive plan
100% employer-paid health insurance (Medical, Dental, Vision) for employees + 50% dependent coverage
Flexible paid time off policy + 11 paid holidays + 12 paid sick days
401(k) retirement account and employer matching (Safe Harbor 4%)
Hybrid working arrangements
Paid parental leave
Relocation assistance available if 50+ miles away from the office
Electric Vehicle (EV) charging ports
Casual dress code
Daily catered lunches, snacks, and accessible kitchen
& more!

If you don’t meet 100% of the preferred skills and experience, we encourage you to still apply!
Second Order Effects is proud to be an Equal Opportunity Employer; employment with SOE is governed on the basis of excellence and will not be influenced in any manner by race, color, religion, gender, national origin/ethnicity, veteran status, disability status, age, sexual orientation, gender identity, marital status, mental or physical disability, or any other legally protected status.
